citations.narrative:
Approximately 10 percent of the dogs were identified with moderate to severe dental disease on their annual exam on
April 13, 2024. However, their individual medical records do not indicate a plan for treatment and care. Although the
program of veterinary care states that licensee will "scale" the teeth as needed, there is no documentation on any of the
affected dog's medical records indicating that their severity of dental disease warrants "scaling" of the teeth nor is there
any documentation that this treatment was performed.
It is important to document all planned treatments and procedures performed on individual dogs that have had a problem
identified on their physical exam to ensure they are receiving appropriate veterinary care.
Correct by May 30, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.13(b)(2) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
Approximately 10 percent of the dogs were identified with moderate to severe dental disease on their annual exam on 
April 13, 2024. However, their individual medical records do not indicate a plan for treatment and care. Although the 
program of veterinary care states that licensee will "scale" the teeth as needed, there is no documentation on any of the 
affected dog's medical records indicating that their severity of dental disease warrants "scaling" of the teeth nor is there 
any documentation that this treatment was performed.  
 
It is important to document all planned treatments and procedures performed on individual dogs that have had a problem 
identified on their physical exam to ensure they are receiving appropriate veterinary care. 
Correct by May 30, 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
 n
